body:
- **Removed Qalculate plugin**: recent versions allow arbitrary command execution, so the plugin as-is is probably not safe to run in public!
- Added BirdLGGo: a simplified IRC frontend to [Bird-lg-go](https://github.com/xddxdd/bird-lg-go/), a looking glass for the BIRD routing daemon
- **Removed FML plugin** (broken due to website changes)
- PkgInfo: removed linuxmint fetcher (broken web scraping)

### Feature changes

- NuWeather: OpenWeatherMap is now the default backend, as Dark Sky's API is being phased out
- NuWeather: Add weatherstack geocode backend (#90) 
- RelayNext: add events.relaySelfMessages option to toggle relaying the bot's output (#98)

### Bug fixes

- LastFM: better error handling; show error messages from the API when available
- AQI: fix encoding place names with spaces in them
- RelayNext: fix antiflood not using the configured timeout value
- RelayNext: don't break relays if one network is disconnected
- RelayNext: fix off-by-one in antiflood when receiving messages on a channel for the first time

### Removals

- **Removed SedRegex - it has been integrated into Limnoria as of release 2020.01.09!**
- Removed Voteserv plugin; there is a better plugin for this (Poll) in stock Limnoria as of version 2021.07.31

### Misc

- Added a comprehensive test suite for RelayNext
- Various test fixes

name: SupyPlugins 2020.01.05
body:
### New features
- **New GitLab plugin (GitLab commit announcer)**, based off code by Moritz Lipp (https://github.com/mlq/limnoria-gitlab)
- **New Qalculate plugin**: a thin wrapper around the [Qalculate! desktop calculator](https://qalculate.github.io/)
- NuWeather: added [OpenWeatherMap](https://openweathermap.org/) backend
- NuWeather: added [weatherstack](https://weatherstack.com/) backend, replacing Apixu
- NuWeather: support showing wind gust details

### Bug fixes / improvements
- SedRegex: properly abort when a search times out
- SedRegex: optimize; spawn a single process to handle the whole history (#89)
- NuWeather: better error handling when looking up an unknown location
- MCInfo: fixed parsing for crafting recipes

### Removed features
- Removed unmaintained plugins CtcpNext, Namegen, PassGen
- PkgInfo: removed outdated CentOS fetcher

name: SupyPlugins 2019.07.09
body:
**This is the last release supporting Python 3.4.** Future versions will require Python 3.5 or higher.

### New features

- NuWeather: support showing extended forecasts via (`weather --forecast`)
    - This adds pendulum as an optional dependency and a `plugins.NuWeather.outputFormat.forecast` config option.
- NuWeather: added Google Maps and OpenCage as geocoding backends (`config help plugins.NuWeather.geocodeBackend`)
- Added a DB migration script from Weather to NuWeather (NuWeather/weather-migrate.py)
- New AQI plugin: fetches air quality index info from [aqicn.org](https://aqicn.org)

### Bug fixes
- FML: update scraper for fmylife.com changes
- NuWeather now saves users in its DB case-insensitively.
- SedRegex: match channel names case-insensitively, since some IRCds don't mangle the case of message targets automatically

### Removed features
- Removed Isup and Weather plugins as they are no longer functioning.

name: SupyPlugins 2019.03.03
body:
Changes since the last snapshot:

- **Added NuWeather, a new weather plugin using Dark Sky and Apixu**.
    - The Weather plugin is now deprecated, since Weather Underground has ceased providing free API access.
- FML: switch to web scraping as the old API is no longer available
- FML: add a `showInfo` option to hide verbose info (ID, categories, link)
- The LastFM plugin can now store users by ident@host or IRC nick.
- RelayNext: add regexp-based message filtering via an `ignoreRegexp` option
- PkgInfo: added package lookup for Gentoo
- Wikifetch: various formatting enhancements

name: SupyPlugins 2018.05.03 (Legacy Python 2)
body:
This is the inaugural release of the maintenance-only Python 2 branch.

- OperUp: fix operup loops when receiving OPERMOTDs on InspIRCd, where the same numerics as regular MOTDs are used
- Wikifetch: various fixes to Wikipedia parsing
- Removed the PortLookup plugin (broken and unmaintainable)
- NoTrigger: fix IndexError when a message only contains spaces
- Wikifetch: ignore GPS coordinates from articles for countries, cities, landmarks, etc.
- SedRegex: make the regexp process timeout configurable

name: SupyPlugins 2018.05.03
body:
- **Python 2 support is removed from the *master* branch and moved into a separate *python2-legacy* branch**, which will only receive maintenance updates going forward.
- OperUp: fix operup loops when receiving OPERMOTDs on InspIRCd, where the same numerics as regular MOTDs are used
- Wikifetch: various fixes to Wikipedia parsing
- **Removed the PortLookup plugin** (broken and unmaintainable)
- **Weather: rewrite to use Weather Underground's geolookup API** (instead of autocomplete)
    - This adds better support for ambiguous locations (e.g. "city, province/state" now works), as well as support for Canadian, U.K. postal codes
- NoTrigger: fix IndexError when a message only contains spaces
- Wikifetch: ignore GPS coordinates from articles for countries, cities, landmarks, etc.
- SedRegex: make the regexp process timeout configurable
- Major rewrite of the PkgInfo plugin (#64):
    - Package lookup for Arch Linux, Fedora, FreeBSD and Linux Mint has been merged into the `pkg` and `pkgsearch` commands
    - Rewrote the Fedora fetcher to use the new [PDC](https://pdc.fedoraproject.org/) API instead of [PkgDB](https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Infrastructure/WhatHappenedToPkgdb), which has been shut down
- TranslateParty: properly strip IRC formatting (#60)

name: SupyPlugins 2017.05.31
body:
#### New plugins - New Quakenet (Q auth) plugin, merged in from https://github.com/GLolol/Supybot-Quakenet - Added an experimental Restart plugin to restart Limnoria from IRC (ProgVal/Limnoria#1070) - Errata: doesn't work on daemonized bots - see #63 #### Enhancements to existing plugins - DDG fixes and improvements: - Expand redirects in URLs as some results now go through a redirect system (i.e. when links take the form https://duckduckgo.com/l/?kh=-1&uddg=https%3A%2F%2Fduckduckgo.com%2F). - Support `!bang` links (redirects) - LastFM enhancements: - Added an option to show extended info (user play count and song tags) - Rewrite YouTube search to use the new DDG code fixed for redirects - Wikifetch now supports a few more sites by default: - Fixed support for Wikia (search and disambiguation parsing) - Added support for wikimedia.org, mediawiki.org - Added preliminary support for non-MediaWiki sites such as https://wiki.ubuntu.com/, via simple `

` tag scraping. - TranslateParty: strip IRC formatting to prevent text corruption (#60) - Weather: add a `locationsearch` command to search up locations, and support the returned [ZMW codes](https://apicommunity.wunderground.com/weatherapi/topics/meaning_of_zmw_city_code) in the `weather` command - This may be useful for when a simple name-based location search is too ambiguous.

- PkgInfo: add Debian codename `bullseye` and Ubuntu codename `zesty`
- SedRegex improvements and bugfixes:
  - More complete error handling, including displaying exact error names instead of "SedRegex error" where applicable
  - Added an 's' regex flag to only match the caller's messages
- SysDNS: show an error if a domain exists but has no A/AAAA/MX record
  - Previously, the bot would give no response to `dns` if this was the case, as both bind9-host and unbound-host will exit with status code 0 and _no_ console output.
- [Archived](https://github.com/GLolol/SupyPlugins/tree/archive/bonuslevel/BonusLevel) the BonusLevel plugin, as it isn't being used anymore.

name: SupyPlugins 2016.09.26
body:
Changes since the last snapshot:
- **Renamed WTE plugin to TranslateParty!**
- PkgInfo: add `filesearch` for searching file contents in Debian/Ubuntu
- PkgInfo: condense `pkg XYZ --depends` output by showing lists of each dependency type
- PkgInfo: rewrite `fedora` to support non-integer versions (e.g. "rawhide")
- PkgInfo: update Ubuntu codenames (add yakkety, remove vivid)
- RelayNext: don't unconditionally lowercase network names when formatting  
- RelayNext: fix case normalization of network names
- RelayNext: improve highlighting prevention using zero-width spaces instead of leading hyphens (#57)
- SedRegex: Filter messages to only those from the current network
- SedRegex: sanitize against `\n\r\t` in output
- SedRegex: work around "nothing to repeat" errors on Python < 2.7.6 (https://bugs.python.org/issue18647)
- Weather: round values for last updated times to the nearest unit

name: SupyPlugins 2016.07.03
body:
- DDG: fix wrong command name in README 
- LastFM: various formatting improvements (390a4e3bfcd35d8767fd6e717fe79202296f15b9)
- PkgInfo: rewritten `centos` lookup command, making the repository name optional and fixing the `-exact/--startswith` filters.
- SupyMisc: remove `getnick` command (duplicate of `Admin.nick`)

- FML: catch non-existing FMLs instead of outputting None fields
- LastFM: prefer looking up account names; use `ident@host` only if the caller isn't registered (#43).
- New MCInfo plugin, for showing Minecraft crafting recipes & block info.
- PkgInfo: move squeeze to debian-archive.
- RelayNext: misc. cleanup and bugfixes:
  - Sort `nicks` output case-insensitively.
  - Show a better error when `nicks` is called on a channel without any relays.
  - Formatting updates: respect noHighlight when relaying the new nick in NICK changes.
  - Properly check for ignores channel-specifically
- **Replacer plugin was renamed to SedRegex**!
  - SedRegex: restore support for alternate delimiters (#50).
- RhymeZone: support is dropped on Python 2.
- SysDNS: allow changing the `host` binary in tests, via environment variable SYSDNS_HOST_COMMAND.
- Weather: fix almanac API parsing (#46).

https://github.com/GLolol/SupyPlugins/compare/2016.02.28.1...2016.05.15

The "Waiter, there's a bot in my soup!" release. Summary of changes since the last release:
- Rewritten LastFM plugin, using the simpler-to-parse JSON API:
  - **Remove `compare` and other commands that no longer work due to API breakages.** - 3564f0b...f03b891
  - Add experimental YouTube link fetching in `np` - 99d6557
- CtcpNext: update docs, add "show" command - b42592a
- **New Replacer and RhymeZone plugins.**
  - Replacer: implement sed-style replacing for channels
  - RhymeZone: plugin to fetch rhymes for words from [rhymezone.com](http://rhymezone.com).
- RelayNext: general improvements
  - Make flood detection command-specific - 1c5dd5f
  - Handle channels case-insensitively when relaying bot messages - 03a29d7...93e558d
  - Don't relay messages to channels we're not in - 688f00a
  - Handle disconnected networks better - a08eb2d...84de8f1
  - Alphabetically sort `nicks` output 2319948
  - Cleanup, switch to using new `msg.tagged('channels')` for NICK and QUIT relaying. **This requires a version of Limnoria newer than https://github.com/ProgVal/Limnoria/commit/f880229d782b678dd28884cac6b70d5cfd54e5c3 (master-2015-12-12 or newer)**.
  -  Ignore PMs and CTCPs other than ACTION - f4cde05...1ae2baa
- SupyMisc: add `average` command, which returns the average of several given numbers - 7af92f8
- Weather: cleanup, allow looking up other users' weather - c82aaf5...f132f2c
- Weather: be more error tolerant if temperature is missing - 3f1e763
- Wikifetch: improvements and bug fixes:
  - Strip newlines from paragraphs to prevent output corruption - c50c50b
  - Modularized wiki fetcher and other internal improvements, add a new `random` command for fetching a random article - 7f5cea7, 08a2942...facd42d, 4109741
- WTE: refresh language list, default to verbose output, and be more error tolerant - a0611ba...287b4ea

[[Full diff]](https://github.com/GLolol/SupyPlugins/compare/2015.09.19...2016.02.28.1)

_Note_: this release was previous known as 2016.02.28, but that tag did not have the plugins' versions updated.

The "Package God" release.

Improvements and fixes to PkgInfo:
- CentOS and Fedora parsers are now available! Updated instructions for how to use them are in the [README](PkgInfo/README.md#CentOS_Packages).
- `vlist`: fix compatibility with Python 2 (026fd318132434188cc218834e1df1c197fb57de).

The "Who knows" release?
- PkgInfo: **some commands were renamed!**
  - `mintpkg` -> **`linuxmint`** (8d15c8777c466fa67f0ce6072391804cf43b4f48)
  - `archpkg` -> **`archlinux`** (c3e62391efa1ce30c25fff439b97c50fc22cc5a1)
- New Wikifetch plugin, forked from ProgVal's Wikipedia plugin @ GLolol/ProgVal-Supybot-plugins@efba93e.
  - Changes include a `--site` option to look up other wikis beside Wikipedia, updated disambiguation page handling, and more.
- Namegen: mention that the 'syllables' config var sets the amount of extra syllables allowed, not the total amount (1775cf3b18459eccc3e84a00309f621f9970f23f)
- CtcpNext: strip formatting, don't allow overriding ACTION/PING (076fb79afeb3bfab00f02cfeda66d905b24ba419)
- New PortLookup plugin: looks up UDP and TCP port numbers [from Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_TCP_and_UDP_port_numbers). (350417675406404d36a35c66f959306f32616c4e)

name: SupyPlugins 2015.05.09
body:
The ["129th day of the year"](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/May_9) release.
- **WTE plugin is dropped, as Google broke the API.** :(
- PkgInfo: rewrite `pkg` command:
  - **`--recommends` and `--suggests` are merged into `--depends`**; it now shows all types of package relations in one command (with fancy colours too!)
  - **`--source` option is added for source lookup**, and allows looking for build-dependencies too in conjunction with `--depends`
  - In `pkg <pkg> --depends`, preserve version/arch-specific dependencies. This prevents misleading duplicate results for packages that depend on different versions of the same package on different architectures.
  - Allow lookup for http://archive.debian.net - simply use an archive codename, such as `pkg lenny bash`.
  - Add Ubuntu 15.10 codename "wily".
- PkgInfo: revert `pkgsearch` syntax changes: it is now `pkgsearch <distro> pkg` again, not `pkgsearch --distro <distro> pkg`.
- Minor formatting changes for Weather (90bc8ef) and Voteserv (2b3d3fe).
- Usage information for all PkgInfo commands have been updated.
- Bug fix for RelayNext: only run flood checking on channels with relays attached.
  - This prevents confusing "Flood detected" messages from appearing in other, unrelated channels.

You can find the full diff here: https://github.com/GLolol/SupyPlugins/compare/2015.04.05.1...2015.05.09

name: SupyPlugins 2015.04.05.1
body:
The "Happy Easter!" release.
- The Weather plugin has been heavily rewritten:
  - Output formatting is changed: both Celsius and Fahrenheit are always shown.  
  - **Configuration option `disableColoredTemp` is removed**. This will likely be re-added in the future as a more global, strip-all-formatting option.
  - Optlist handling (`--almanac`, `--metric`, etc.) is removed.
  - **The `wunderground` command is renamed to `weather`**. It's a lot nicer to type!
- Improvements and bug fixes for RelayNext:
  - Fix `QUIT` relaying (for real this time...)
  - Wrap `nicks` output if it exceeds maximum message length (#27).
  - Channel-specific configuration options are now respected for `NICK` and `QUIT` relaying.
- Voteserv: store full hostmasks instead of wildcards in database. This should be backwards compatible.

You can find the full diff [here](https://github.com/GLolol/SupyPlugins/compare/2015.03.11...2015.04.05.1).

name: SupyPlugins 2015.03.11
body:
- Rewrite parts of the LastFM plugin, now storing users by hostmask instead of nick.
  - Unfortunately, this requires a full database reset.
- CtcpNext now uses standard substitutes (`$version`, `$nick`, etc.) instead of hardcoded `%t` and `%v` tags.
  - This will also require one to update the database (or reset it using the `clear` command).

name: SupyPlugins 2015.02.17
body:
Development snapshot at 2015.02.17.
- LastFM: Refactoring and bug fixes:
  - `lastfm` command is now split into various subcommands (`friends`, `toptracks`, etc.)
  - Make the plugin threaded, preventing errors/API timeouts from freezing the bot.
- DDG: initial parser for zero-click results (command `zeroclick`)
- RelayNext:
  - Merge `remove` and `unset` commands into `remove`
  - Add tests for `add`, `remove`, `set`, etc.
  - Documentation updates.
- TLDInfo stub is dropped.

name: SupyPlugins 1.7.1-dev
body:
- DDG: reintroduce support for multiple results.
  - Snippets can be toggled on and off using `config plugins.ddg.showSnippet`
  - Result amount is set using `config plugins.ddg.maxresults`
- Bugfixes for SupyMisc and Namegen.
- Improvements to RelayNext:
  - Experimental flood-prevention system; see `config list plugins.RelayNext.antiflood`.
  - Add an ignore feature: This uses Supybot's built in ignore system, but allows configuring which events to drop from ignored users. It defaults to blocking `PRIVMSG` and `MODE` (i.e. for ChanServ), and is configurable via `plugins.RelayNext.events.userignored`.
  - Support relaying topic changes (off by default, turned on via `plugins.RelayNext.events.relaytopic`).
- PkgInfo updates:
  - `pkgsearch` syntax is updated: use `--distro <distro>` to specify a distribution (distro is optional now and defaults to 'debian').
  - `vlist --source` is removed; a normal `vlist` call can search up source packages fine.

name: SupyPlugins 1.5.6
body:
Bugfix release: SupyMisc and Namegen.
- Namegen (b21043826d92b3128e4): fix a bug where lists started popping in names (hi, `Sart['un', 'yay']neta`!)
- SupyMisc: fix incorrect parsing of options in `colors`

name: SupyPlugins 1.5.5
body:
Beta release. Changes from 1.5.4-alpha:
- Bugfixes for NoTrigger and SupyMisc.
- New RelayNext plugin is introduced, replacing the older RelayLink system. Read more about it [here](RelayNext/README.md).
- OperUp plugin is removed.
- CtcpNext: limit `set`/`unset` commands to admin.

Changes from 1.4.1:
- New plugins RelayNext, FML, DDG, Weather, and WTE (experimental). 
- Voteserv now handles database flushing using Supybot's internal flush mechanism. This removes the `voteimport` and `voteexport` commands, since they are no longer needed. (#19)
- Randomness, OperUp, and RelayLink plugins dropped.
- NoTrigger now uses zero-width spaces for protection - this is completely invisible compared to a space!
- Many more bug fixes and enhancements!

name: 1.5.4-alpha | Last release for OperUp/RelayLink
body:
- New CtcpNext plugin.
- Minor bugfixes.
- **Last release containing OperUp and RelayLink**, these plugins have been removed!

name: SupyPlugins 1.5.3-dev
body:
The Christmas release.
- Maintenance updates for RelayLink, NoTrigger, and SupyMisc.
- Bug fixes for DDG plugin (some searches errored out in the past).
- New [FML](FML) plugin.
- LastFM plugin no longer depends on Beautiful Soup.

name: SupyPlugins 1.5.2-dev
body:
Development snapshot.
- Voteserv now handles database flushing using Supybot's internal flush mechanism. This removes the `voteimport` and `voteexport` commands, since they are no longer needed. (#19)
- New DDG plugin (searches for sites on DuckDuckGo)
- Maintenance updates to RelayLink and LastFM.

name: SupyPlugins 1.5.1-dev
body:
1.5.1 Development snapshot.
- WTE: switch over to a stabler Translate API, fixing some HTTP 503 errors.
- Further enhancements to PkgInfo:
  - Handle virtual packages in `pkg` command correctly
  - New feature: `pkg <distro> <package> --depends/--recommends/--suggests` to check out dependencies of a package.
  - Removed `vlist --reversed` option (use `--reverse` instead)
- NoTrigger now uses zero-width spaces to protect your bots. It's completely invisible, so nobody will ever notice! ;)

name: SupyPlugins 1.5.0-dev
body:
1.5 Development release.
- Add new WTE plugin (experimental and still needs testing, Python 3 only).
- Minor updates to SupyMisc (`supyplugins` can now return source links), LastFM, and PkgInfo (formatting).
- Weather plugin imported from [GLolol/Supybot-Weather](https://github.com/GLolol/Supybot-Weather)
- Randomness plugin is dropped and moved into [its own repository](https://github.com/GLolol/Randomness)

name: SupyPlugins 1.4.1
body:
Bugfix release (Namegen and LastFM). 
- Namegen: the amount of syllables that a name can have is now configurable.

name: SupyPlugins 1.4-rc1
body:
1.4-rc1 release. Changes from 1.3-alpha2:
- Updated LastFM snapshot, with a large API overhaul and some other changes ([diff](https://github.com/GLolol/supybot-lastfm/compare/GLolol:8c00e324...devel))
- Minor updates to SupyMisc:
  - Move 'colors' command from Randomness to SupyMisc
  - Config variable `repeat.max` is renamed to `maxLen` (it no longer just affects the repeat command)
- Updates to PkgInfo:
  - `--reverse` option added in `vlist` to show newest versions first.
  - `archs` config variable now implies 'source' and 'all', fixing issues with arch-independent packages not being shown.
- Updates to Voteserv:
  - Added Admin override clause (enabled by `config plugins.voteserv.allowadminoverride`)
  - New listallvotes command to list everything that has been voted for
  - Added --hosts and --number options to `votes`, for listing hostnames that have voted for an action and the number of people respectively.

You can see the full list of changes from 1.2 by scrolling down! (just look at the pre-release tags)

name: SupyPlugins 1.2.1
body: This bugfix release fixes quit relaying in RelayLink and whitespace handling in SysDNS.

name: SupyPlugins 1.3-alpha2
body:
SupyPlugins 1.3-alpha2. Changes:
- Bugfixes for RelayLink, NoTrigger, and SysDNS.
- PkgInfo syntax is slightly updated, with the 'package' command renamed to 'pkg' for better consistency.
- LastFM plugin added (imported from [GLolol/supybot-lastfm](https://github.com/GLolol/supybot-lastfm)).

name: SupyPlugins 1.3-alpha1
body:
Development release. Some plugins were renamed/moved, take note of this when upgrading!
- PkgInfo: `vlist` gets a `--source` option for searching packages by source.
- **TLDInfo is dropped** with all functionality **merged into SupyMisc**, please use this instead!
- Randomness's voting functionality is split into a separate plugin (Voteserv). **Those using the Randomness database prior to commit 96e19ae will have their databases reset**!
  - Database handling was updated to be slightly more efficient. There is now 1 database for all networks (the previous mechanism did not handle separate databases correctly despite the file being named `(network).db`; this was unintentional.

name: SupyPlugins 1.2
body:
The "almost Halloween" release. This is a maintenance release from 1.2-rc1, with testcases being fixed and Travis CI enabled.

Major changes from 1.0, the previous stable release:
- Python 3 support (3.4+)
- PkgInfo is greatly revamped and now depends on [Beautiful Soup 4](http://www.crummy.com/software/BeautifulSoup/bs4/doc/), an HTML and XML parsing library for Python. New commands include:
  - `mintpkg` - fetch info from [Linux Mint's repositories](http://packages.linuxmint.com).
  - `pkgsearch` - glob searching Debian/Ubuntu's repositories.
- Namegen plugin added.

For a full list of changes, please see the [commit history](https://github.com/GLolol/SupyPlugins/compare/v1.0...1.2).

name: SupyPlugins 1.2-rc1
body:
1.2 Release Candidate 1. This is a bugfix/maintenance only release from 1.1-beta1.
- 1.1 is skipped as quite a lot has changed since the last stable (1.0).
  - Major changes include Python 3 support, PkgInfo being completely overhauled, and a new Namegen plugin.
  - (I may choose to develop an odd-number-is-development versioning scheme entirely.)

name: SupyPlugins 1.1-beta1
body:
1.1 beta-1. Summary of changes:
- New Namegen plugin (random name generator)
- PkgInfo: added `mintpkg` command for querying Linux Mint packages: http://packages.linuxmint.com/
- OperUp is deprecated due to low usefulness, future modifications will be for _maintenance only_!
- RelayLink is now in maintenance mode also, future modifications will be for _maintenance only_!
- SupyMisc: add `mreplace` command
- NoTrigger now catches all prefixes in string.punctuation (`!"#$%&\'()*+,-./:;<=>?@[\]^_\`{|}~`) instead of those in a small, predefined/hardcoded list.

name: SupyPlugins 1.1-alpha2
body:
1.1-alpha2. Changes:
- PkgInfo now depends on [Beautiful Soup 4](http://www.crummy.com/software/BeautifulSoup/bs4/doc/), an HTML and XML parsing library for Python. Instructions on how to install it are present in the [README](README.md).
- PkgInfo: added a pkgsearch command for searching packages in Debian and Ubuntu's repositories.
- TLDInfo was broken in the last alpha release, this has now been fixed (my bad!)
- Unit tests were added for some plugins (ref #13).
  - These can be ran by cloning the repository, changing to its directory, and running `supybot-test <plugin>/`
- Python 3 support is now working (this wasn't properly mentioned in 1.1-alpha1's ~~really messy~~ release notes).

name: SupyPlugins 1.0
body: A year of work = the first release! Enjoy.

name: SupyPlugins 1.0-rc1
body: The first true release.
